shortdesc.ph: Enables accelerated rendering of audio and video frames.
Enables accelerated rendering of audio and video frames.
Enables accelerated rendering of audio and video frames.
Enables accelerated audio and video frame rendering.

section.p: After this method is successfully called, the SDK enables accelerated rendering for both video and audio, speeding up the first frame rendering and audio output after joining a channel.
After successfully calling this method, the SDK enables accelerated rendering for both video and audio frames, which speeds up the time to first frame and first audio after a user joins a channel.
After successfully calling this method, the SDK enables accelerated rendering mode for both video and audio, which speeds up the time to first frame and first sound after joining a channel.
After successfully calling this method, the SDK enables accelerated rendering for both video and audio, which speeds up the first frame rendering and audio output after a user joins the channel.
section.note: Both broadcaster and audience must call this method to experience accelerated rendering. Once successfully called, you can only disable accelerated rendering by calling the method to destroy the object.

Both broadcaster and audience must call this method to experience accelerated audio and video rendering. Once this method is successfully called, you can only disable accelerated rendering by calling the method to destroy the object.

Both the host and audience need to call this method to enable accelerated rendering of audio and video frames to experience this feature. Once this method is successfully called, you can only disable accelerated rendering by calling the method to destroy the object.

Both broadcaster and audience need to call this method to enable accelerated audio and video frame rendering to experience the feature. Once this method is successfully called, the only way to disable accelerated rendering is to destroy the object by calling .

section.title: Scenario
section.p: Agora recommends enabling this mode for audience users in live streaming scenarios.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li:
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
-7: The is not initialized when the method is called.

< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
-7: not initialized before calling the method.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li:
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
-7: is not initialized when calling the method.
